description.narrative: The overall aim of this study is to develop a strategy for increasing access to, and consumption of, nutritious leafy vegetables among indigenous communities in Samoa, Solomon Islands and Fiji. Leaves have been identified as valuable sources of micronutrients, including minerals and carotenoids, as well as protein. Project objectives are to: identify leafy vegetables with the potential to improve human nutrition; investigate and document the reasons for acceptability of different leafy vegetables; and develop a strategy for further research and awareness-raising about their health benefits. This study complements a planned Pacific Agribusiness Research for Development Initiative (PARDI) small research activity on commercial aspects of nutritious vegetables, including market development and loss of nutritional value in postharvest handling.
